victim.name: Phineas Ravenscar
victim.occupation: A devoted priest assigned to the old chapel nestled within the haunted library, offering spiritual guidance and solace to those troubled by the eerie occurrences.
victim.personality: He was deeply nurturing and supportive, always ready to lend a listening ear to the distressed souls wandering the library's shadowed halls.
victim.cause_of_death: Electrocuted due to a deliberate sabotage of the library's aging electrical system, his death marked by an unnatural flicker of the ancient lights just moments before.

profile.name: Eloise Grimsbane
profile.description: A reclusive historian obsessed with uncovering the library's darkest secrets, often venturing alone into restricted sections.
profile.relationship_to_victim: An academic frequently at odds with Father Ravenscar over access to sacred texts.

original_mmo.means: Eloise, with her deep knowledge of the library's hidden infrastructure, deliberately tampered with the aging electrical system in a restricted section, causing a controlled malfunction that electrocuted Father Ravenscar when he accessed the chapel's circuits.
original_mmo.motive: Her obsession with uncovering forbidden knowledge led to bitter conflicts with Father Ravenscar, who blocked her access to sacred texts she believed held crucial secrets; driven by frustration and fixation, she sabotaged the system to eliminate his interference.
original_mmo.opportunity: Frequently exploring the library's restricted and less frequented sections alone, Eloise had ample time and privacy to manipulate the electrical wiring undetected before Father Ravenscar was killed in the chapel.

modified_mmo_elements.original_element_description: Eloise, with her deep knowledge of the library's hidden infrastructure, deliberately tampered with the aging electrical system in a restricted section, causing a controlled malfunction that electrocuted Father Ravenscar when he accessed the chapel's circuits.
modified_mmo_elements.modified_element_description: Despite her knowledge of the library's hidden infrastructure, forensic examination revealed Eloise's fingerprints were absent from the electrical panel, and a recent maintenance log showed a technician had inspected and disabled tampering in that section hours before the murder.
modified_mmo_elements.reason_for_modification: The forensic and maintenance evidence removes Eloise's capability to have physically tampered with the system, weakening her means.

profile.name: Horace Crowley
profile.description: The facility's groundskeeper, struggling with mounting debts and increasingly erratic behavior due to stress.
profile.relationship_to_victim: Responsible for maintenance of the library, had frequent practical disagreements with the priest.
profile.chosen_motive_category: Desperation (e.g., to escape debt or dire situation)

original_mmo.means: Horace tampered with the aging electrical wiring in the section of the library near the chapel, creating a faulty circuit designed to cause a fatal electrocution when triggered by the victim's presence.
original_mmo.motive: Overwhelmed by mounting debts and fearing ruin, Horace saw eliminating the priest as a way to remove his frequent critic and gain unchallenged control over the library’s maintenance and resources, which he hoped to exploit for financial gain or leverage.
original_mmo.opportunity: Horace had unrestricted access to the library's grounds and facilities, allowing him to sabotage the electrical system overnight when the library was closed and the victim was known to conduct his evening prayers and counseling sessions in the chapel.

profile.name: Genevieve Coldwell
profile.description: A fearful member of the clergy who believes the priest's spiritual guidance has attracted dangerous malevolent forces to the library.
profile.relationship_to_victim: Fellow clergy member uneasy about Ravenscar's unorthodox methods and his influence.

original_mmo.means: Genevieve, familiar with the library's electrical system through her duties and frequent presence there, deliberately tampered with the wiring in hidden conduits, causing a fatal electrocution when Phineas interacted with the lights during his routine checks.
original_mmo.motive: She feared that Phineas's spiritual guidance was summoning dangerous malevolent forces into the haunted library, endangering them all; her unease grew into desperation, believing his removal was necessary for their safety and her own self-preservation.
original_mmo.opportunity: As a fellow clergy member with regular access to the chapel and surrounding library areas, Genevieve had ample opportunity to sabotage the electrical system unnoticed during off-hours, particularly in the moments before Phineas was electrocuted while performing his duties.

modified_mmo_elements.original_element_description: She feared that Phineas's spiritual guidance was summoning dangerous malevolent forces into the haunted library, endangering them all; her unease grew into desperation, believing his removal was necessary for their safety and her own self-preservation.
modified_mmo_elements.modified_element_description: Though she expressed concern about the dangers posed by the spiritual guidance, Genevieve was ultimately devoted to preserving life and had recently counseled Phineas to avoid reckless rituals, showing her intent was protection rather than elimination.
modified_mmo_elements.reason_for_modification: This reframing of her motive from desperation to protective caution weakens the likelihood that she intended to harm Phineas.

evidence_items.description: Eloise was seen arguing heatedly with Father Ravenscar over access to a restricted book section just days before the murder.
evidence_items.connection_explanation: This confrontation suggests Eloise had strong personal reasons to bear a grudge against Father Ravenscar, indicating a possible motive.

evidence_items.description: Library visitors reported seeing Eloise frequently exploring secluded parts of the library late at night, including areas near the chapel's restricted circuits.
evidence_items.connection_explanation: Her habitual presence in the restricted library areas could give her the chance and privacy to attempt sabotage, implying opportunity despite forensic evidence to the contrary.

evidence_items.description: A detailed blueprint of the library's electrical layout was found among Horace Crowley's personal belongings, with notes marking the chapel's wiring section and indications of recent modifications.
evidence_items.connection_explanation: This blueprint shows Horace's intimate knowledge and intentional tampering with the chapel's electrical system.

evidence_items.description: Financial records revealing Horace's deep debts, compounded by documents expressing his frustration with Phineas Ravenscar's frequent criticisms of library funding and resource allocation.
evidence_items.connection_explanation: These records demonstrate Horace's financial desperation and motive to eliminate a critic blocking his control.

evidence_items.description: Security camera footage timestamps show Horace entering the library late at night when it was closed, coinciding with the period Phineas was alone in the chapel for prayers.
evidence_items.connection_explanation: This evidence confirms Horace's opportunity to sabotage the electrical system unnoticed.

evidence_items.description: Several witnesses recall Genevieve voicing grave concerns about Phineas's rituals potentially inviting dark spirits, indicating her strong emotional investment in the chapel's safety.
evidence_items.connection_explanation: Her fears about the rituals suggest a motive rooted in self-preservation and protection, initially implying possible hostility.

evidence_items.description: An inspection found minor disturbances in the chapel's electrical conduits consistent with unauthorized tampering, and Genevieve’s routine presence there places her near these locations around the time of the incident.
evidence_items.connection_explanation: Because of her familiarity with the electrical system, this evidence hints at her having the means to cause the electrocution, creating suspicion.
